oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Piano Recital by William Duncan Allen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Program for a piano recital by William Duncan Allen. Located at Fisk Memorial Chapel, at 8:00 P.M. on Friday, July 13, 1928.

William Duncan Allen (1906-1999) was a concert pianist, teacher, and music critic. He attended Oberlin College and the Juilliard School of Music for music studies and taught at Howard University and Fisk University. Allen toured with musicians such as Todd Duncan, William Warfield, and Paul Robeson. Later in life, he wrote for the Berkeley Post and the Black Music Research Journal. He then served as minister of music at South Berkeley Community Church for 26 years.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Allen, William Duncan, 1906-1999
